strategy_reasoning: Uses the established 'digital garden' metaphor to make a heavy technical changelog (48 PRs) feel organic and rewarding. The retro RPG UI elements allow for specific information density without breaking the cozy, lo-fi aesthetic.
visual_style: Cozy 8-bit pixel art, Stardew Valley aesthetic, lime green (#ecf874) accents, warm pastel gradients, chunky sprites.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of Polly the Bee (yellow/brown stripes, pink blush) hovering in a lush digital garden. She is wearing a tiny farmer's straw hat. In the foreground, a rustic wooden pixel-art signpost reads 'WEEKLY HARVEST'. Two smaller garden markers sticking out of lime green (#ecf874) soil read 'Showcase V2' and 'Polly API'. Soft pastel gradient background of peach and mint. Warm lighting, Stardew Valley vibes. High quality 8-bit aesthetic, detailed foliage.
images.description: Sets the scene for the weekly update as a bountiful harvest of code.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art workshop interior. The Monitor Robot (chunky body, CRT head) is pointing excitedly at a glowing lime green (#ecf874) terminal screen that reads 'AUTO-POLLY'. Polly the Bee sits on top of the monitor wearing tiny wizard glasses. On the brick wall, a framed pixelated blueprint poster says 'OpenAI Ready'. Warm low-light atmosphere, chunky sprites, retro computing vibes, scattered tools.
images.description: Highlights the technical backend updates (Auto-agent and API compatibility) in a playful workshop setting.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art lounge. The round tan Nomnom creature (mochi ball) is happily eating a thick stack of paper logs labeled '48 PRs'. A pixel art arcade cabinet in the background glows with lime green (#ecf874) light and is labeled 'New Apps'. A clipboard hanging on the wall reads 'Build Diary'. Soft lavender and cream lighting. Wholesome, funny, A Short Hike aesthetic.
images.description: Celebrates the volume of work and community contributions with the hungry mascot.

caption:
48 PRs merged this week. The garden is growing.

We renovated the App Showcase (it actually looks good now), taught Polly to speak OpenAI, and deployed a self-healing agent to fix our own messy code. Also moved our NPM packages to a proper home and added a visual Build Diary because text logs are boring.

New community apps include SlidePainter and... BrainrotMaker. You're welcome.

Code is open. Go build something.

#pollinations #opensource #generativeai #pixelart #weeklyupdate #indiedev #buildinpublic #creativecoding
